## mortAAR

With `mortAAR` you can calculate a **life table** based on
archaeological demographic data. You just need the number of people of a
certain age, but you can also use single individual data. `mortAAR`
allows to separate the data according to sex/location/epoch or any other
grouping variable.

What is a life table \[aka discrete time survival analysis\]? According
to
[Chamberlain](https://books.google.de/books?id=nG5FoO_becAC&lpg=PA27&ots=LG0b_xrx6O&dq=life%20table%20archaeology&pg=PA27#v=onepage&q&f=false)
it is a

> “(…) mathematical device for representing the mortality experience of
> a population and for exploring the effects on survivorship of
> age-specific probabilities of death. One reason why life tables have
> been ubiquitous in demography is that mortality cannot easily be
> modelled as a single equation or continuous function of age.”

To our knowledge as of writing, a simple to use and easily accessible
tool to calculate and create archaeological life tables has been
lacking. That is why we sat down and put `mortAAR` for R together. We
hope it will be of use for archaeologists world-wide.

In our view, `mortAAR` shines in the following areas:

- Ease and flexibility of input (different kinds of customization and
  grouping)
- Sophisticated means of computation (exploding of age ranges,
  separation factor for average lived years)
- Comprehensiveness of output (life tables for all groups specified,
  plots for the most important measures, relative population
  calculation)

For further information, please have a look at the Vignettes – [Basic
usage](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR/vignettes/mortAAR_vignette-1.html),
[Extended
discussion](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR/vignettes/mortAAR_vignette_extended.html),
[Life table
correction](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR/vignettes/mortAAR_vignette_lt_correction.html)
and
[Reproduction](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR/vignettes/mortAAR_vignette_reproduction.html)
– and the
[Manual](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR/mortAAR.pdf).

## Installation

`mortAAR` is available on
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=mortAAR) and can be installed
through `install.packages("mortAAR")`. You can also install the
development version with:

    if(!require('remotes')) install.packages('remotes')
    remotes::install_github('ISAAKiel/mortAAR', build_vignettes = TRUE)

## Licence

`mortAAR` is released under the [GNU General Public Licence, version
3](https://www.r-project.org/Licenses/GPL-3). Comments and feedback are
welcome, as are code contributions.

# Package index

## Basic functions

- [`prep.life.table()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/prep.life.table.md)
  : Creates the input for the function life.table
- [`life.table()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/life.table.md)
  : Calculates a life table
- [`plot`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/plot.md) : Plot
  a mortaar_life_table or a mortaar_life_table_list
- [`print`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/print.md) :
  Encode and print a mortaar_life_table or a mortaar_life_table_list

## Advanced functions

- [`lt.representativity()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.representativity.md)
  : Checks the representativity of the non-adult age groups in a mortAAR
  life table
- [`lt.correction()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.correction.md)
  : Calculates a corrected life table from a mortAAR life table
- [`lt.reproduction()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.reproduction.md)
  : Calculates reproduction indices from a mortAAR life table
- [`lt.sexrelation()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.sexrelation.md)
  : Calculate masculinity index and maternal mortality from a mortAAR
  life table list
- [`lt.population_size()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.population_size.md)
  : Calculates population size from a mortAAR life table or numeric
  values
- [`halley.band()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/halley.band.md)
  : Halley band of the mortality profile of a skeletal population

## Helper functions

- [`lt.indices()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/lt.indices.md)
  : Generates indices from a mortAAR life table for use in other
  functions
- [`pop.sim.gomp()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/pop.sim.gomp.md)
  : Simulation of a population of adults with Gompertz distribution
- [`random.cat()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/random.cat.apply.md)
  [`random.cat.apply()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/random.cat.apply.md)
  : Generation of random age ranges
- [`as.mortaar_life_table_list()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/mortaar_life_table.md)
  [`as.mortaar_life_table()`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/mortaar_life_table.md)
  : mortaar_life_table and mortaar_life_table_list

## Data sets

- [`aiterhofen_oedmuehlen`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/aiterhofen_oedmuehlen.md)
  : aiterhofen_oedmuehlen: Life table example
- [`gallery_graves`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/gallery_graves.md)
  : gallery_graves: Life table example
- [`magdalenenberg`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/magdalenenberg.md)
  : magdalenenberg: Life table example
- [`muensingen`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/muensingen.md)
  : muensingen: Life table example
- [`nitra`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/nitra.md) :
  nitra: Life table example
- [`odagsen_cm`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/odagsen_cm.md)
  : odagsen_corpus.mandibulae: Life table example
- [`odagsen_mo`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/odagsen_mo.md)
  : odagsen_margo.orbitalis: Life table example
- [`schleswig_ma`](https://isaakiel.github.io/mortAAR/reference/schleswig_ma.md)
  : schleswig_ma: Life table example
